head.title: Business Class As a Way of Life

hedline.hl1: Business Class As a Way of Life

abstract.p: Dean Hughson letter on Mar 8 New York Times Magazine issue on frequent business travelers; photo (S)

block.p: A lot of my fellow road warriors join me in saying thank you for noticing the life style of some of us (''Business Class as a Way of Life,'' A Special Issue, March 8). It is a difficult life style, but one that is getting easier with E-mail and cellular phones that can follow you. In the early 80's, when businessmen like myself would go into mainland China or Russia or even Mexico, it was as if we were going into outer space. No one could find us. I knew that a new era had begun the day I was driving in a rural area in the state of Jalisco, Mexico, and my cellular phone rang. It was a friend in Europe calling from his cellular phone and it sounded as if he were next door.

In the early 80's, when businessmen like myself would go into mainland China or Russia or even Mexico, it was as if we were going into outer space. No one could find us. The untold story, though, of people on the road is the loss of marriages, the loneliness and the feeling of being virtual that comes when E-mail is your only connection to family and friends. Thank you for this great issue that lets others into our world.
